# image

**Instance Property**

The cursor’s image.

## Declaration

```swift
var image: UIImage { get }
```

```swift
var image: NSImage { get }
```

## Discussion

The cursor image or `nil` if none exists. Note that an `NSCursor` object is immutable: you cannot change its image after it’s created. Instead, use [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCursor/init(image:hotSpot:)] to create a new cursor with the new settings.

## Related Documentation

- **init(image:hotSpot:)**: Initializes a cursor with the given image and hot spot.

## Setting cursor attributes

- **hotSpot**: The position of the click location within the cursor.
- **hide()**: Makes the current cursor invisible.
- **unhide()**: Negates an earlier call to [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCursor/hide()] by showing the current cursor.
- **setHiddenUntilMouseMoves(_:)**: Sets whether the cursor is hidden until the mouse moves.
